'The Golden Ratio is what you get when a / b = (a + b) / a. That is, a larger number divided by a smaller number equals the sum of both numbers divided by the larger number. This works out to 1.618033... and so on, infinitely. To make it easy to visualize, we can use a Golden Rectangle, which is what you get when you have a rectangle, where one side is a, and the other is a + b. Here's an image to make it clear. The big rectangle has the proportions of (a + b) x a. What links the Golden Rectangle to the Golden Ratio is that the small rectangle on the right has the same width to height ratio, and the measurements are a x b. So, in a Golden Rectangle, the proportions of a x b = (a + b) x a, which is the same as the Golden Ratio. This means that you can effectively cut off the left part of the rectangle, and be left with another rectangle of the same proportions on the right side. Since it has the same width to height ratio as the first rectangle, this makes it a Golden Rectangle too.

The gyaru's starting boyfriend deserved all of this and more. It's like BRO, every man has  a period in life where they're down on their luck and Gyaru-chan seemed to understand this.. As a man, you suddenly  lost your job & your are low on funds, maybe your prospects are dwindling, perhaps you had  a sudden injury or  car accident with legal problems don't seem to end..... it's  complete shit and we've all been there or will be there at one point. That's a really tough place to be.  You can do lots of things though, what you DO NOT DO, is raid your wife's stashed savings  and blow it on pachinko, PACHINKO. I'd be less disgusted if a character blew the wife's stash on drugs than on pachinko.  Seriously what the fuck dude,  blew his woman's savings on pachinko? really? REALLY? that bit legit pissed me off more than any NTR I've read, I'm unironically "triggered" by that part of this story. Fuck
